subject: Programming
title: The Future of Programming Languages
description: A fast breakdown of The Future of Programming Languages for builders.

hook.text: New languages appear every year, but very few survive past their first decade.

buildup.text: Trends point toward safety, concurrency, and developer experience as the winning traits.

discovery.text: AI code assistants now write code in any language, making syntax matter less than ideas.

twist.text: Some predict natural language will replace code entirely. Others call that a fantasy.

climax.text: Languages evolve like species. The best adapted to new hardware and new problems survive.

punchline.text: The best language is the one not yet written.

quiz.question: What traits are modern programming languages trending toward?
